did.unittitle: Letters
Richard Henry Dana Sr.to James Abraham Hillhouse

scopecontent.p: [Sending copy of Richard Henry Dana Jr.'s sea journal [Two Years Before the Mast]; discusses public interest; mentions visit from a sailor who had sailed with Dana Jr. and who reported sailors' interest in the book.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Sr.to Sarah N. Arnold

scopecontent.p: [Responds to the Arnolds' invitation to stay with them in New Bedfordwhen he lectures; mentions attending a John Brahamconcert; refers to a note from a Mr. Morison.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Sr.to Unknown

scopecontent.p: [Re prospective lecturing in New York, Brooklynand Baltimorefor correspondent and/or Edward Terryor [Edward L.] Keyes; says he has "none but his old lectures"; has heard Dana Jr. in twice in court and comments he did well.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to James Deshon

scopecontent.p: [Re obtaining a pew seat for Deshon; says Dana Sr. had already given away family pew seats.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Sr.to Leonard Jarvis

scopecontent.p: [Discusses Washington Allstonanecdotes; mentions his planned book on Allston; tells of the recovery of an earlier part of Allston's "great picture" (Belshazzar's Feast) which had been painted over.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Sr.to Jonathan Mason Jr.

scopecontent.p: [Invites him to see "the great unfinished picture" again in Allston's Cambridgeporthouse.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charles Eliot Norton

scopecontent.p: [Arrangements for a walking trip together in Manchester, Mass.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to R. I. Burbank

scopecontent.p: [Asks about Cincinnatireputation of Dr. Morton whose Cincinnatidebts had been settled by Burbank; some of Morton's opponents had spread rumors in Boston he says are untrue.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Samuel Gridley Howe, Wendell Phillips, William Jackson

scopecontent.p: [Declines invitation to meeting since he disagrees with some of those arranging it who are "in favor of dissolution of the Union"; mentions his dissatisfaction with "Mr. Webster's course" (referring to Daniel Webster's 7th of March speech advocating the Compromise of 1850).]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Erasmus D. Beach

scopecontent.p: [Requests copy of ( Massachusettsstate Senator) Beach's report and bill; biographical note on Dana on bottom of letter in different handwriting.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Sr.to William A. Jones

scopecontent.p: [Mentions daughter's poor health, his own aging, his Poems and Prose Writingsand lack of financial reward from writing, and Jones' publications; questions point of preparing lectures for publication; discusses his seashore home and dissatisfaction with Hammatt Billings' sketch of it in Homes of American Authors. Signature cut off and on of Dana Jr. glued on.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Sr.to Chauncey K. Williams

scopecontent.p: [Identifies writer of letter sent him by correspondent as William Stedman, who married his mother's sister; both were daughters of William Ellerywhom Dana Sr. saw often "at my father's."]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Henry B. Osgood

scopecontent.p: [Refuses invitation to lecture.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Sr.to A. D. W. French

scopecontent.p: [Brief cover note with a one verse quotation from "The Buccaneer."]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to John Prescott

scopecontent.p: [Agrees to advise correspondent and sets appointment for him.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to "President of the Convention"

scopecontent.p: [Enthusiastic endorsement of Charles Francis Adamsfor Congress.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to James Ripley Osgood

scopecontent.p: [Asks him to send copy to Father Hicks, editor of The Catholic World. Pencilled note from Osgood on letter top signed "J.R.O." asks someone to be sure this has been done.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Sr.to Jonathan Mason Jr.

scopecontent.p: [Tells of Mrs. Washington Allston's death.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Sr.to Jonathan Mason Jr.

scopecontent.p: [Expresses sympathy for Mason's son's death.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Sr.to J. Cist

scopecontent.p: [About location of Dana Sr.'s signature on a photograph.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to William Pitt Fessenden

scopecontent.p: [Queries Fessenden if he had changed his opinions of the proposed Fourteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution; mentions Massachusettsvoters' indifference and a strong party forming against the proposal because under it, the United Stateshas to admit the states, the proposal retards the progress of other proposed Fourteenth Amendments, Massachusettsvoting requirements could be affected, and if it were rejected a better course of action might be adopted; says he is writing to Fessenden only and will keep secret his reply or use it as Fessenden desires.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to James T. Fields

scopecontent.p: [Unable to take part in Fields' "Dickens' Dinner" any time that week.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to William Maxwell Evarts

scopecontent.p: [Expresses disgust about machine politics, Senate's consideration of the articles of impeachment of President Andrew Johnson, and his own failed efforts "to stem the tide" in Massachusetts; mentions views of [Robert Cummings] Schenck. Part of this letter has been cut away, but not the signature.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to "Proprietors of [ ] Globe"

scopecontent.p: [Places order for the "President's Trial."]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Bon voyage letter to future son-in-law recommending sightseeing in Englandand a tailor and clothiers.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Sampson, Low and Co.

scopecontent.p: [His preference for the Fields, Osgood, and Co.sketch of the brig to that in Sampson, Low and Co.edition of Two Years Before the Mast; requests minor changes and an accounting.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Sr.to Jonathan Mason Jr.

scopecontent.p: [Recommends Mrs. Hooper have Walter Brackettclean Washington Allston's picture,"Elijah Fed by Ravens"; mentions poor health. Note on letter mentions subsequent ownership of the Allston painting.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to C. L. Street

scopecontent.p: [Responds to query about a monument for Samuel Finley Breese Morse; says Professor Francis Dananot his brother or uncle but a remote relative and honored friend of his father and will forward compliment to Francis Dana's widow.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana

scopecontent.p: [In Portlandwhere he is arguing a case; mention her sisters Lily Dana, Henrietta Dana, and Sally Danawho is feeling much better; left 25 pages of manuscript "on board" with Captain Burke.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Expresses concern for him and his family (after the ChicagoFire).]

scopecontent.p: [Sending Lyman and his brother book on fire insurance.]

scopecontent.p: [Giving permission to announce engagement to daughter Charlotte Dana. ]

scopecontent.p: [Letter accompanying Charlotte Dana's journal from Europe. ]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Forwarding Lyman's letter to Charlotte Danain Stuttgart, Germany. ]

scopecontent.p: [More about Charlotte Dana's European journal.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Asking about job offer received by Lyman.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana

scopecontent.p: [Tells her of trust set up by Aunt Sarah's will providing dowries for Dana's daughters; settlement will be either yearly allowance or down payment for a house.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Re Lyman's plans in the "new" Chicagoand Charlotte Dana's financial expectations upon her marriage.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Re Charlotte Dana's savings transfer to Lyman for deposit on Chicagolot.]

scopecontent.p: [Re Lyman's Englewood( Chicago) lot purchase; includes draft and offers some money to obviate need for mortgage.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Re news of Charlotte Dana's European journal; mentions Mrs. Dana is in Baden Badenwhile Henrietta Dana, Charlotte Dana, and Rosamund Danaare at Cadiz. ]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Sends money to pay off lot mortgage when it comes due.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Suggests he may prefer to use all the money to avoid a mortgage and may put a lot in Dana's name.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Responding to Lyman's request for advice about changing his profession, discusses law and business professions; suggests he examine his own "duties and purposes in life."]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Agrees to send more money for a third lot in Englewoodand the title to be in Lyman's name.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Cover letter for lot purchase money with torn list of college boat race times.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Apologizes for forgetting to endorse check; amusing critique of Harvard- Amherstboat race.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Congratulates him on becoming a Notary Public; discusses real estate and pleasure in reading Charlotte Dana's last European journals.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Re Charlotte Dana's Englewoodreal estate; transactions were to equalize Charlotte's financial situation with her sisters'.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Thanks him for mentioning another available lot but cannot spare the money for the investment.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Re Lyman's interests, current activities, family news, opinion of the new Hawaiian sovereign, and his own law practice; mentions health.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Discusses merits of law school vs. study with individual lawyer; hopes Lyman's parents will visit Boston; regrets missing Mr. Jackson; expresses enjoyment at Lyman's account of the new king of Hawaiiand proposal to abstract to the Advertiser, with due safeguards as to its authorship.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Critical discussion of Middlemarch; mentions his admiration and describes the novel as a depressing picture reminding him of "that deary waste of afterthoughts" watching a ship's wake at night.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to William Adolphus Wheeler

scopecontent.p: [Asks him to reserve the volume of Sir W. Hamilton. ]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Thanks for returning Charlotte Dana's journals; asks that Lyman sell Chicagolots or not as he sees fit.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Further comments on law training, the excellence of Harvard Law Schooland his pleasure if Lyman were to be nearby, and the excellence of Charlotte Dana's journals; asks that proceeds from sale of Dana's lots not be invested in railroad property.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana

scopecontent.p: [Re deeds, property, shipping receipts for furniture but none for portrait; Lyman may attend Harvard Law School; Lily Danawell enough to sail with Dana.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [To sail with Lily Danafor Europewhere he will learn more of Lyman's plans from Charlotte Dana; recommends Harvard Law Schoolas best course for Lyman.]

did.unittitle: C. J. Kinoto Richard Henry Dana Jr.

scopecontent.p: [ Londontailor thanks him for his business; sends prices for clothing.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana

scopecontent.p: [Written on House of Lordsstationery while waiting in lobby; mentions Lily Dana's poise in London with his friends Lord Frederick Cavendishand Lord Kinnaird; mentions visit to St. Paul's with Leferve, an hour with Canon Liddon and plans for Dovervia Canterbury, then Brussels, then etc.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Concerns clothing made for Lyman by Londontailor Kino.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana

scopecontent.p: [Re apartment for Charlotte, her trunks, furniture and other personal affects.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana

scopecontent.p: [Relays Isabelle Dana's invitation for her to stay in Chestnut Street since Dana Jr. and family will be away.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Samuel C. Cobb

scopecontent.p: [Has a heavy cold but will try to attend invitation to dinner a honoring King of Hawaiian Islands.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charles Deane

scopecontent.p: [Unable to send copy of Dana's speech although complimented by request.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Alexander N. Harris

scopecontent.p: [Confirms Harris' position in philosophy and history committees from list in his possession, rather than the list Mr. Cabot had used.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Francis Ogden Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Tells of Aunt Betsey's death and asks him to relay news to the David Lymans.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana

scopecontent.p: [Account of "White Mountain Style" drive to join family for vacation in Bethlehem, N.H.and mentions plans to visit North Conway. ]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana

scopecontent.p: [Mentions family vacation in Manchester, Mass.and drive to the Loring Museum.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana

scopecontent.p: [Mentions strong northeaster blowing at the shore and the Olmsteads.]

did.unittitle: Sara Watson Danato Charlotte Dana, with Richard Henry Dana Jr.note added

scopecontent.p: [Passes on housekeeping hiring details from mother; best wishes to her future husband from Dana Jr. who mentions the > Tribune's comments on [Benjamin Franklin] Butlerand "poor" letters of Pierpont to it.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to James R. Osgood and Co.

scopecontent.p: [Thanks for volume of Tennyson's "Harold."]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Mentions family's great concern that she and her husband might have been in the train wreck near Ashtabulain route to Chicago; sends draft and bridal money; misses her.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Expresses pleasure at Richard Dana's engagement to Edith Longfellow; attempts to cheer up Charlotte and Francis Ogden Lymanwho are both sick.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Forwarding Mary Dana's gift to her soon; Dana's reception for Richard Danaand Edith Longfellow; guests included Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, Rev. Sam Longfellow, Mrs. Nathan Appleton, Mrs. Child, Mrs. Greeley Curtis; Dana Sr. unable to come.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Concerns Charlotte's journals; Dana's family visits to Hyde Park; status of his law cases; mentions Frank Dana. ]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana Lyman
Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana Lyman
Richard Henry Dana Jr.to Charlotte Dana Lyman

scopecontent.p: [Distressed Charlotte and Francis Ogden Lymanlost all their money in a bank failure; asks what they need and whether she lost her money from the trust.]

scopecontent.p: [Thanks for his many kind acts and particularly for something Taylor has written in the Tribune. ]

scopecontent.p: [Advises she take books Dana Sr. wishes to give her even if she must store them.]

scopecontent.p: [Re engagements of two friends.]
